contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox MLB player |name=José Malavé |image= |position=[[Outfielder]] |bats=Right |throws=Right |birth_date={{Birth date and age|1971|5|31}} |birth_place=[[Sucre State|Cumaná, Sucre State]], [[Venezuela]] |death_date= |debutdate=May 23 |debutyear={{By|1996}} |debutteam=[[Boston Red Sox]] |finaldate=August 30 |finalyear={{By|1997}} |finalteam=[[Boston Red Sox]] |stat1label=[[Batting average]] |stat1value=.226 |stat2label=[[Home run]]s |stat2value=4 |stat3label=[[Run batted in|Runs batted in]] |stat3value=17 |teams=<nowiki></nowiki> * [[Boston Red Sox]] ({{By|1996}}-{{By|1997}}) * [[Yokohama BayStars]] ({{By|1998}}) ([[Nippon Professional Baseball|NPB]]) * [[Haitai Tigers]] ({{By|2000}}) ([[Korea Baseball Organization|KBO]]) |highlights= }} '''José Francisco Malavé''' [mah-lah-VEY] (born May 31, 1971 in [[Sucre State|Cumaná, Sucre State]], [[Venezuela]]) is a former [[Major League Baseball]] [[outfielder]] who played with the [[Boston Red Sox]] (1996–1997). In parts of two seasons, Malavé was a .226 [[Batting average|hitter]] with four [[home run]]s and 17 [[Run batted in|RBI]] in 45 career games, after which he played in [[Japan]]ese and [[Korea]]n [[baseball]]. Malavé was the third base coach for Venezuela in the [[2009 World Baseball Classic]]. ==External links== *{{Baseballstats |mlb= |espn= |br=m/malavjo01 |fangraphs=1008012 |cube=Jose-Malave}} *{{japanesebaseball|id=1024}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Malave, Jose | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Baseball player | DATE OF BIRTH = May 31, 1971 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Sucre State|Cumaná, Sucre State]], [[Venezuela]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Malave, Jose}} [[Category:1971 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Cumaná]] [[Category:Major League Baseball players from Venezuela]] [[Category:Boston Red Sox players]] [[Category:Major League Baseball outfielders]] [[Category:Venezuelan expatriate baseball players in Japan]] [[Category:Yokohama BayStars players]] [[Category:Expatriate baseball players in South Korea]] [[Category:Haitai Tigers players]] [[Category:Gulf Coast Red Sox players]] [[Category:Elmira Pioneers players]] [[Category:Winter Haven Red Sox players]] [[Category:Lynchburg Red Sox players]] [[Category:New Britain Red Sox players]] [[Category:Pawtucket Red Sox players]] [[Category:Carolina Mudcats players]] [[Category:People from Sucre (state)]] [[Category:Sioux City Explorers players]] [[Category:Nashua Pride players]] [[Category:St. Paul Saints players]] {{Venezuela-baseball-outfielder-stub}}
